message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper deals with using Dynamic Vision Sensors (DVS) for Human Activity Recognition (HAR), which involves computer vision and machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the use of DVS in wearable platforms, which falls under the sub-category cs.RO (Robotics). The paper proposes a new feature extraction method using motion maps, which involves machine learning techniques and could be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also uses Motion Boundary Histogram (MBH) for feature extraction, which is a common technique in video analysis and could be categorized under cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of the proposed method on benchmark datasets and a real DVS gesture dataset, which involves experimental evaluation and could be categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
